sub_title: Spectroscopy and Catalysis Expert at TMC Science & Technology
summary:
I am an experienced physical chemist with 13+ years of research and R&D project management. I love working with diverse teams of professionals that provide analytical microscopy and spectroscopy solutions to develop better performing functional materials. I develop, validate, and integrate modern spectroscopy methods to industrial processes for diagnostics of materials and chemicals.
I hold a PhD in applied optical & X-ray spectroscopy, microscopy, and heterogeneous catalysis. I worked at world-renowned chemistry and physics research institutions, numerous X-ray synchrotron facilities, and in chemical industry research labs. Currently, I am applying the knowledge and passion for spectroscopy and catalyst materials working on projects at Ketjen Corporation.

Working on spectroscopy and catalysis projects at Ketjen Corporation (former Albemarle Catalysts Company).', 'title': 'Analytical Chemistry Expert', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 10259390, 'name': 'Leiden Institute of Physics', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEuF-KFwD1sVQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519905288826?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ANuPnltm319QJkKmq4kzfQo9JpxL0r3OP6cUgQb3JHo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/leiden-institute-of-physics/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'University of Leiden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Leiden Institute of Physics', 'description': 'Our team is developing new fluorescent emitters for quantum physics applications,  i.e., integrating organic molecules into quantum solid-state photonic devices and sensors (https://www.nature.com/articles/s41563-021-00987-4). The project is a part of the large EU initiative for quantum technologies (QuantERA, https://www.quantera.eu/), where I serve as a local coordinator.  
I manage cryogenic laser spectroscopy research projects within the framework, which has so far delivered several relevant experimental concepts and devices. We recently presented the first molecular quantum emitters highly sensitive to electric fields and have demonstrated the photonic concept-device based on optical tuning of single-molecule emission.', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 166740, 'name': 'Utrecht University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQG6HfmPTdJKXw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519884681258?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=i09IbD7RibJlZYVNrl7o5pIy-Ip7_0I2XZqXZA9kXUI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/universiteit-utrecht/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Group of Inorganic Chemistry and Catalysis', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Utrecht University', 'description': 'I coordinated the research on self-assembly and growth of metal-organic framework (MOF) thin films, which has resulted in the development of an automated synthetic methodology and state of the art characterization of the films. 
Our team has published the first nano-IR study of a MOF material. I have also enabled reflection-absorption infra-red diagnostics of the growth of MOF films. Automated synthetic process that we have developed has significantly improved the synthesis times and quality of the MOF films. 
During this time I have co-supervised the imaging projects of four PhD students and co-authored three research papers on integration of fluorescence microscopy methods in materials science research.', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Debye Institute for Nanomaterials Science', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Utrecht University', 'description': 'During my PhD, I developed novel experimental methods to study zeolite chemistry at the level of single particles, molecules and atoms. Zeolites are the workhorses of modern oil refining and petrochemical industry, but the methods to study their chemical reactivity at the nanoscale are scarce. This work resulted in a total of 6 first-authored papers reporting state-of-the-art experimental studies of zeolite structure and reactivity. I employed two fluorescence probe reactions to study zeolite chemistry at the single-particle/single-molecule level, including:
- quantitative super-resolution imaging of zeolite reactivity on industrially relevant steamed zeolite crystals (the cover and spotlights of JACS, issue 20, 2015).
- the first single-molecule fluorescence experiment on an industrial real-life (fluid catalytic cracking) catalyst
- the first demonstration of the substituent and solvent effects on proton-transfer rates at the single-turnover level
- the first experimental single-molecule demonstration of a reversible and site-dependent proton transfer in zeolites
- the first X-ray crystallographic and X-ray-excited luminescence reactivity imaging of a single zeolite crystal
- in addition, I have co-authored several research papers, including the first atom-probe tomography study of zeolite crystals

During this time, I have also participated in, organized and executed more than 15 synchrotron X-ray studies of catalyst materials, including X-ray microscopy and spectroscopy studies of zeolites, fluid-catalytic cracking particles and Fischer-Tropsch catalysts.', 'title': 'PhD Research Assistant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Faculty of physical chemistry', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Faculty of physical chemistry', 'description': "Dissertation title: ''DFT Study of Hydrogen Adsorption on (1 1 1) Surfaces of FCC Transition Metals''", 'title': 'M.Sc.', 'employment_type': None}]}]
